info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 22 at 5:01PM EDT until August 22 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 501 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Northampton, or near Allentown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Northampton, Hellertown, Nazareth, Slatington, Bath, Walnutport, Steuben, Coffeetown, Beersville, Lehigh University, Catasauqua, Fountain Hill, Coplay, North Catasauqua, Freemansburg, Chapman, Fullerton and Hokendauqua. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 57 and 64. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 52 and 54, and between mile markers 64 and 69. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
